title: Algorithms for calculating MF from hierarchical data
code: a <- data.frame(   room = paste("Room", rep(c("W", "Z"), each = 24)),   pen = paste("Pen", rep(LETTERS[1:6], each = 8)),   litter = paste("Litter", rep(11:22, each = 4)),   tx = rep(rep(c("vac", "con"), each = 2), 12) ) set.seed(76153) a$lung[a$tx == "vac"] <- rnorm(24, 5, 1.3) a$lung[a$tx == "con"] <- rnorm(24, 7, 1.3) a <- a[-48, ]  # DETERMINING MITIGATED FRACTION thismfh <- MFh(formula = lung ~ tx + room / pen / litter, data = a) MFnest(thismfh, which.factor = "pen") MFnest(thismfh, which.factor = "All")  # BOOTSTRAPPING MFClusBootHier(formula = lung ~ tx + room / pen / litter,                data = a, boot.unit = FALSE,                boot.cluster = TRUE, alpha = 0.1,                which.factor = c("room", "litter", "All"))  mfboot_multiple$MFhBoot$bootmfh |>   filter(bootID == 1) |>   select(c("bootID", "room", "pen", "litter"))

title: Quick Start when calculating MF from Hierarchical Data
text: function MFClusBootHier allows bootstrapping approach calculating mitigated fraction values. Input arguments : non-bootstrapped usage (.e. MFClusHier) formula: formula form y ~ x + /b/c y continuous response, x factor two levels treatment, /b/c grouping variables. Nesting assumed order, left right, highest lowest. single level “” contain multiple levels “b” single level “b” contain multiple levels “c”. data: data table (data.frame tibble) variables identified argument formula. extra variables, ignored. compare: Treatment groups, text vector length two. first position [1] treated control reference group members second position [2] compared. .factor: Variable(s) interest. can grouping variables data set. “” specified, summary MF calculated whole tree. Additional arguments nboot: Number bootstrapping events. boot.unit: Boolean whether sample observations within core. boot.cluster: Boolean whether sample clusters present. TRUE, trees clusters represented original data others subset. alpha: Complement confidence level. used MFClusBoot. seed: Used initialize random number generator reproducibility. “core” unique combination variable levels data, including compare designation. Table 1, one core Room W/Pen /Litter 11/vac another Room Z/Pen F/Litter 22/con. “cluster” unique combination variable levels data, without compare designation. Table 1, first four observations core, Room W/Pen /Litter 11. Refer MFClusHier help page (?MFClusBootHier) extended usage details. discussion regarding bootstrapping algorithm can found Algorithms calculating MF hierarchical data.

title: MFClusBootHier — MFClusBootHier
text: formula Formula form y ~ x + /b/c, y continuous response, x factor two levels treatment, /b/c grouping variables corresponding clusters. Nesting assumed order, left right, highest lowest. single level "" contain multiple levels "b" single level "b" contain multiple levels "c". data data.frame tibble variables specified formula. Additional variables ignored. compare Text vector stating factor levels - compare[1] control reference group compare[2] compared. nboot number bootstrapping events boot.unit Boolean whether sample observations within core. boot.cluster Boolean whether sample cores present. TRUE, trees cores others subset. .factor variables include mitigated fraction summation. Default "", sum entire tree. alpha Passed emp_hpd calculate high tailed upper high tailed lower mitigated fraction. seed Passed MFhBoot initialize random number generator reproducibility.

title: MFhBoot — MFhBoot
code: MFhBoot(   formula,   data,   compare = c("con", "vac"),   nboot = 10000,   boot.unit = TRUE,   boot.cluster = TRUE,   seed = sample(1:1e+05, 1) )

title: MFhBoot — MFhBoot
text: formula Formula form y ~ x + /b/c, y continuous response, x factor two levels treatment, /b/c grouping variables corresponding clusters. Nesting assumed order, left right, highest lowest. single level "" contain multiple levels "b" single level "b" contain multiple levels "c". data data.frame tibble variables specified formula. Additional variables ignored. compare Text vector stating factor levels - compare[1] control reference group compare[2] compared. nboot number bootstrapping events boot.unit Boolean whether sample observations within core. boot.cluster Boolean whether sample cores present. TRUE, trees cores others subset. seed initialize random number generator reproducibility. Passed set.seed.

title: MFhBoot — MFhBoot
text: list following elements: bootmfh: Rank table bootstrapped values output MFh. Includes new bootID variable distinguish bootstrapped incidence. clusters: Table unique nodes ID. compare: Compare vector specified user. mfh: MFh run original data input.

title: Class mfhlboot — mfhlboot-class
text: nboot: Numeric value specifying number samples. alpha: Numeric value specifying complement confidence interval. seed: Vector integers specifying seed pseudo-random number generator used. compare: Vector character strings naming groups compared. rng: Character string naming type random number generator. sample: bootstrapped values. MFstat: Matrix columns observed, median, lower, upper Equal Tailed Highest Density estimates mitigated fraction (MF). HLstat: Matrix columns observed, median, lower, upper Equal Tailed Highest Density estimates Hodge-Lehmann estimator (HL). QDIFstat: Matrix columns observed, median, lower, upper estimates Quartile Differences. QXstat: Matrix columns observed, median, lower, upper quartiles treatments, equal tailed. QYstat: Matrix columns observed, median, lower, upper quartiles response, equal tailed.
